1. More and more + 複数形 + are ~ing
2. More and more + 不可算名詞 + is ~ing
3. The number of 複数形 + is increasing
4. The amount of 不可算名詞 + is increasing

```
These days more and more Japanese people are traveling abroad. - 最近では海外に行く日本人が増えている
The number of cars in this town is increasing. - この街の車が増えている
The amount of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere is increasing year by year. - 大気中の二酸化炭素が年々増加している
```

1. these days / nowadays（一般的に現在時制で使う）
3. recently / lately（一般的に現在完了か過去時制の文で使う）

```
In those days not many people had TVs, but these days a lot of households have more than one. - その当時テレビを持っている人は少なかったが、最近では2台以上持っている家庭が多い
I have only recently started to learn French. - フランス語を始めたのはつい最近のことだ
```

Few + 可算名詞の複数形

```
Few people attended the meeting yesterday. - 昨日その会議に出席した人は少なかった
```

A few + 可算名詞の複数形

```
A few people attended the meeting yesterday. - 昨日その会議に出席した人が少しいた
```

A lot of people ~ 

```
A lot of people complain that prices are too high. - 物価が高すぎるとこぼす人が多い
```

Some people ~ 

```
Some people say that the earth is getting warmer and warmer. - 地球温暖化が進んでいるという人もいる
```

Most people ~

```
Most people want to be happy. - 大抵の人は幸福になることを望んでいる
```

It is a pity that S + V

```
It is a pity that young people today don't take much interest in their own culture. - 今日の若者が自国の文化に余り興味を示さないのは残念だ
```

mistakenly believe that S + V

```
Some people mistakenly believe that Japanese are a homogeneous people. - 日本は単一民族だと勘違いしている人がいる
```
